SEARCH
Package com.landawn.abacus.util

Class URLEncodedUtil

java.lang.Object
com.landawn.abacus.util.URLEncodedUtil
public final class URLEncodedUtil extends Object

Note: it's copied from Apache HttpComponents developed at The Apache Software Foundation (http://www.apache.org/), or under the Apache License 2.0. The methods copied from other products/frameworks may be modified in this class.

A collection of utilities for encoding URLs.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final String
    NAME_VALUE_SEPARATOR
    The constant representing the equals character ('=') used as a name-value separator in URL query parameters.
    static final char
    QP_SEP_A
    The constant representing the ampersand character ('invalid input: '&'') used as a separator in URL query parameters.
    static final char
    QP_SEP_S
    The constant representing the semicolon character (';') used as a separator in URL query parameters.

  • Method Details

    • decode

      public static Map<String,String> decode(String urlQuery)
      Decodes a URL query string into a Map using the default charset. The keys and values in the Map are the parameter names and values from the URL query string.
      Parameters:
      urlQuery - The URL query string to decode.
      Returns:
      A Map containing parameter names as keys and parameter values as values.

    • decode

      public static Map<String,String> decode(String urlQuery, Charset charset)
      Decodes a URL query string into a Map using the provided charset. The keys and values in the Map are the parameter names and values from the URL query string.
      Parameters:
      urlQuery - The URL query string to decode.
      charset - The charset to use for decoding the URL query string.
      Returns:
      A Map containing parameter names as keys and parameter values as values.

    • decodeToMultimap

      public static ListMultimap<String,String> decodeToMultimap(String urlQuery)
      Decodes a URL query string into a ListMultimap using the default charset. The keys and values in the ListMultimap are the parameter names and values from the URL query string. If a parameter name appears multiple times in the query string, all its values will be stored in the ListMultimap.
      Parameters:
      urlQuery - The URL query string to decode.
      Returns:
      A ListMultimap containing parameter names as keys and parameter values as values.

    • decodeToMultimap

      public static ListMultimap<String,String> decodeToMultimap(String urlQuery, Charset charset)
      Decodes a URL query string into a ListMultimap using the provided charset. The keys and values in the ListMultimap are the parameter names and values from the URL query string. If a parameter name appears multiple times in the query string, all its values will be stored in the ListMultimap.
      Parameters:
      urlQuery - The URL query string to decode.
      charset - The charset to use for decoding the URL query string.
      Returns:
      A ListMultimap containing parameter names as keys and parameter values as values.

    • decode

      public static <T> T decode(String urlQuery, Class<? extends T> targetType)
      Decodes a URL query string into a bean of the specified type using the default charset. The keys and values in the object are the parameter names and values from the URL query string.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the object to decode into.
      Parameters:
      urlQuery - The URL query string to decode.
      targetType - The bean class of the object to decode into.
      Returns:
      An object of type T containing parameter names as keys and parameter values as values.

    • decode

      public static <T> T decode(String urlQuery, Charset charset, Class<? extends T> targetType)
      Decodes a URL query string into a bean of the specified type using the provided charset. The keys and values in the object are the parameter names and values from the URL query string.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the object to decode into.
      Parameters:
      urlQuery - The URL query string to decode.
      charset - The charset to use for decoding the URL query string.
      targetType - The bean class of the object to decode into.
      Returns:
      An object of type T containing parameter names as keys and parameter values as values.

    • parameters2Bean

      public static <T> T parameters2Bean(Map<String,String[]> parameters, Class<? extends T> targetType)
      Converts a Map of parameters into a bean of the specified type. The keys in the Map should correspond to the property names of the bean. The values in the Map should be String arrays, where each String in the array is a value for the corresponding property in the bean. If a property in the bean corresponds to multiple values in the Map, the property in the bean should be an array or a collection.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the bean to create.
      Parameters:
      parameters - The Map of parameters to convert into a bean.
      targetType - The class of the bean to create.
      Returns:
      A bean of type T with its properties set to the values from the Map.

    • encode

      public static String encode(Object parameters)
      Encodes the provided parameters into a URL query string using the default charset. The parameters can be a Map, a bean class with getter/setter methods, or an array of property name and value pairs.
      Parameters:
      parameters - The parameters to be encoded.
      Returns:
      A URL query string with the encoded parameters.

    • encode

      public static String encode(Object parameters, Charset charset)
      Encodes the provided parameters into a URL query string using the specified charset. The parameters can be a Map, a bean class with getter/setter methods, or an array of property name and value pairs.
      Parameters:
      parameters - The parameters to be encoded.
      charset - The charset to use for encoding.
      Returns:
      A URL query string with the encoded parameters.

    • encode

      public static String encode(Object parameters, Charset charset, NamingPolicy namingPolicy)
      Encodes the provided parameters into a URL query string using the specified charset and naming policy. The parameters can be a Map, a bean class with getter/setter methods, or an array of property name and value pairs.
      Parameters:
      parameters - The parameters to be encoded.
      charset - The charset to use for encoding.
      namingPolicy - The naming policy to be used for property names during encoding.
      Returns:
      A URL query string with the encoded parameters.

    • encode

      public static String encode(String url, Object parameters)
      Encodes the provided parameters into a URL query string using the default charset. The parameters can be a String URL and an Object which can be a Map, a bean class with getter/setter methods, or an array of property name and value pairs.
      Parameters:
      url - The URL to which the encoded parameters will be appended.
      parameters - The parameters to be encoded.
      Returns:
      A URL query string with the encoded parameters appended to the provided URL.

    • encode

      public static String encode(String url, Object parameters, Charset charset)
      Encodes the provided parameters into a URL query string using the specified charset. The parameters can be a String URL and an Object which can be a Map, a bean class with getter/setter methods, or an array of property name and value pairs.
      Parameters:
      url - The URL to which the encoded parameters will be appended.
      parameters - The parameters to be encoded.
      charset - The charset to use for encoding.
      Returns:
      A URL query string with the encoded parameters appended to the provided URL.

    • encode

      public static String encode(String url, Object parameters, Charset charset, NamingPolicy namingPolicy)
      Encodes the provided parameters into a URL query string using the specified charset and naming policy. The parameters can be a String URL and an Object which can be a Map, a bean class with getter/setter methods, or an array of property name and value pairs.
      Parameters:
      url - The URL to which the encoded parameters will be appended.
      parameters - The parameters to be encoded.
      charset - The charset to use for encoding.
      namingPolicy - The naming policy to be used for property names during encoding.
      Returns:
      A URL query string with the encoded parameters appended to the provided URL.

    • encode

      public static void encode(Object parameters, Appendable output)
      Encodes the provided parameters into a URL query string using the default charset. The parameters can be a Map, a bean class with getter/setter methods, or an array of property name and value pairs. The encoded URL query string is appended to the provided Appendable.
      Parameters:
      parameters - The parameters to be encoded.
      output - The Appendable where the encoded URL query string will be appended.

    • encode

      public static void encode(Object parameters, Charset charset, Appendable output)
      Encodes the provided parameters into a URL query string using the specified charset. The parameters can be a Map, a bean class with getter/setter methods, or an array of property name and value pairs. The encoded URL query string is appended to the provided Appendable.
      Parameters:
      parameters - The parameters to be encoded.
      charset - The charset to use for encoding.
      output - The Appendable where the encoded URL query string will be appended.

    • encode

      public static void encode(Object parameters, Charset charset, NamingPolicy namingPolicy, Appendable output) throws UncheckedIOException
      Encodes the provided parameters into a URL query string using the specified charset and naming policy. The parameters can be a Map, a bean class with getter/setter methods, or an array of property name and value pairs. The encoded URL query string is appended to the provided Appendable.
      Parameters:
      parameters - The parameters to be encoded.
      charset - The charset to be used for encoding.
      namingPolicy - The naming policy to be used for property names during encoding.
      output - The Appendable where the encoded URL query string will be appended.
      Throws:
      UncheckedIOException
